alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Caroline; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; Eastern King William; Goochland; Lunenburg; New Kent; Nottoway; Powhatan; Prince George; Western Chesterfield; Western Essex; Western Hanover; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond); Western King William; Western King and Queen; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 8:25PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Isolated strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Nottoway, southeastern Goochland, Hanover, Dinwiddie, southeastern Powhatan, Chesterfield, northeastern Mecklenburg, southeastern Lunenburg, northwestern King and Queen, northwestern New Kent, northwestern Westmoreland, Henrico, central Caroline, northwestern King William, eastern Amelia, northwestern Essex and northern Brunswick Counties, the City of Colonial Heights, the western City of Petersburg and the City of Richmond through 930 PM EST... At 824 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking showers and isolated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Oilville to near Chula to 6 miles northeast of Boydton. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds to 40 to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Moseley, Montpelier and Wyndham around 830 PM EST. South Hill around 835 PM EST. Ashland around 840 PM EST. Kenbridge, Bon Air, Tuckahoe and Kings Dominion around 845 PM EST. University Of Richmond, Downtown Richmond, Alberta and Dundas around 850 PM EST. Richmond, Virginia Union University, Milford, Virginia Commonwealth University, Lakeside, Laurel and Glen Allen around 855 PM EST. Bowling Green, Mechanicsville, Highland Springs, East Highland Park and Fort Pickett around 900 PM EST. McKenney, Hanover, Studley, Fort A.p. Hill and Wilsons around 905 PM EST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Bacons Fork, Dolphin, Murdocks, Etna Mills, Sandston, Forksville, Glendale, Pocahontas State Park, Skinquarter and Wellville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
